description: From Middle English kyllyng; equivalent to kill +‎ -ing.

adjectives.description: killing (comparative more killing, superlative most killing)

entries.meaning: That literally deprives of life; lethal, deadly, fatal.

examples: Should true Proportion ev'ry Mortal grace, / And Semetry be seen in ev'ry Face: / Beauty no longer would be thought divine, / Nor would its Charms with half the Lustre shine: / No courtly Dame a killing Look could boast, / If once the Foils of Homeliness were lost.

entries.meaning: That makes one ‘die’ with laughter; very funny.
examples: Livia found her ‘killing’, and derived such amusement from her Martinique French that he was forced to enjoy her as well.

entries.meaning: An instance of someone being killed.
(informal, usually as make a killing) A large amount of money.
examples: He made a killing on the stock market.
